text:
Interpretation  of  aeromagnetic  imagery  by  the  Company  suggests  that  a  fault  zone 
 extends  out  of  the  Saddleback  greenstone  belt  to  the  south  east  through  the  Darkan 
 tenement. The fault displays structural dislocations and flexures, also possible late stage 
 felsic intrusions have been mapped along the fault within the Darkan tenement.

collected,  and  were  submitted  for  multi-element  analyses.  Due  to  current  access 
 restrictions, most of the land being covered by farms, all the sampling was done along 
 Slightly  elevated  gold,  copper  and  silver  values  were  reported  at  several  locations, 
 several times higher than background. The best zone of anomalism is located within an 
 area of shearing and quartz veining exposed in a road cutting, seemingly adjacent to the 
 interpreted trace of the Darkan Fault. 
 These  reconnaissance  sampling  results  are  considered  encouraging,  supporting  the 
 company’s exploration concept 
 To advance the project further, a search of the land ownership has to be completed and 
 compensation / access agreements with the landholders put in place. After this the next 
 phase can be implemented.

text:
held as private farming land, constraining access to sampling sites, as a result the initial 
 sampling had to be carried out along public roads and tracks where they were deemed to 
 cross favourable structural and/or geological positions. 
 The Darkan Exploration licence is situated wholly within the Collie 1:250 000 map sheet 
 SI  50-6,  the  tenement  location  is  approximately  160km  southerly  from  Perth  situated 
 about 35 kilometres south westerly from the town of Williams . 
 Access from Perth is along the Albany highway to Williams, then to the northern part of 
 the  tenement  along  the  Williams  –  Collie  highway  or  to  the  southern  part  via  the 
 Williams-Darkan-Collie sealed road. 
 Internal access along the long axis of the tenement is by the Dunnaniling – Quindanning 
 road. This road is only partly sealed.

  data search of open file records was made was made in an attempt to document any 
 previous modern day exploration of the area. 
 ecords were found showing some exploration activity in the region. Several companies 
 were  active  in  the  area  since  the  year  1970.  However  none  of  these  were  looking  for 
 HP  was  exploring  in  the  area  for  Bauxite  in  the  1970’s,  calling  the  venture  The 
 Williams Bauxite Project. The area included Darkan.  
 RA Exploration Ltd  investigated the area for occurrences of Kaolin during the period 
 1996 – 1997. The work included Air-core drilling. 
 A Kaolin Holdings Pty Ltd also explored in the area, surrendering their tenements in 
 May 2004. They were investigating the possibility of finding commercial quantities of 
 quality paper coating grade kaolin clay. 
 RCLEME carried out laterite sampling and multi-element analyses of the region during 
 1998. The geochemistry data (CSIRO Database) has been published in several open file
